results.title: Ford Motor Company | Research Starters - EBSCO
results.content: # Ford Motor Company. Ford Motor Company is a renowned multinational automotive manufacturer founded in 1903 by Henry Ford and headquartered in Dearborn, Michigan. ## Ford Motor Company. Founded in 1903 by Henry Ford, the Ford Motor Company is the oldest of the big three American automakers and manufactures vehicles under two brand designations: Ford and Lincoln. In 2023, the Ford Motor Company sold around 4.4 million vehicles worldwide. To achieve this goal, the Ford Motor Company pioneered new assembly practices that moved the vehicle along a production line of stationary workers. Ford Motor Company made several failed attempts to diversify its line of car brands through acquisitions. In its press release announcing the new Michigan manufacturing plant, Ford Motor Company stated that the decision was purely a business one, and no deal with President Trump had been made. The Ford Motor Companyâ€™s founder Henry Ford remains a vivid figure in American industrial history more than a century after he founded his automobile company.
